parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To place together, commend, prove, exhibit; instrans: I stand with; To be composed of, cohere.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: Himself, herself, itself.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Probably from the same as pale; anew, i.e. back, once more, or furthermore or on the other hand.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From a compound of apo and hormao; a starting-point, i.e. an opportunity.
A boasting; a ground of boasting (glorying, exultation). From kauchaomai; a boast in a good or a bad sense.
Gen: in behalf of; acc: above.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: To boast; I glory (exult) proudly. From some base akin to that of aucheo and euchomai; to vaunt.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
From pros and ops; the front, i.e. The countenance, aspect, appearance, surface; by implication, presence, person.
And, even, also, namely.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Prolonged from a primary kar; the heart, i.e. the thoughts or feelings; also the middle.
